column3: What is the behaviour currently?  How often does a sanity check run right now?\n

Right now runs for every transaction if -checkmempool is specified,
otherwise never.

So the behaviour for =0 and =1 remains the same, but higher number can be
used for lower test frequency.
ACK.  Looks like travis needs to be bumped?\n
This has a bug: -checkmempool=1 never checks due to integer overflow in the nCheckFrequency= dFrequency*4294967296 and nCheckFrequency is uint32_t, so the result ends up 0.\n
I feel like this would be clearer as two (or at least one) `if` conditionals.\n
Not sure: but would't it be more clean to use `ULONG_MAX` here? Also not sure: if using `4294967296` instead of `4294967295`(= ULONG_MAX) wouldn't this result in autocast to `uint64_t`?\n
Note the .0, making it a double constant rather than an int.\n
Also, ULONG_MAX gives the maximum value of an unsigned long. Here we need\nthe number of possible values in a uint32_t. That is by definition 2^32.\n
IMHO this value should've taken a small comment :).\n
